required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study in Clinical Practice Management of Patients With Biological Drugs in Monotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Profile and Clinical Management of Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis Treated With Biologic Therapy Alone

brief_summary.textblock: This observational multicenter study will evaluate the management of disease and safety in clinical practice in patients with moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis receiving any biological therapies in monotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Level of Education Completed
primary_outcome.description: Level of education completed is a component of socio-demographic characteristics. It is recorded as cannot read, no formal education, primary education or equivalent, general secondary education, vocational education, and higher education or equivalent. Data were collected at study entry (Single visit study)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Smoking Habits
primary_outcome.description: Smoking habits is a component of socio-demographic characteristics. Participants' smoking status is recorded as non-smoker, smoker, and ex-smoker at Visit 1.

primary_outcome.measure: Smoking-habit for Smokers or Ex-smokers (Packs in Years)
primary_outcome.description: Smoking-habit included number of pack per years is reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Smoking-habit or Smokers or Ex-smokers (Smoking/Quit Smoking )
primary_outcome.description: Smoking-habit included years of smoking/quit smoking is reported for participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Time of Onset of Rheumatoid Arthritis
primary_outcome.description: Onset of rheumatoid arthritis is a component of clinical characteristics.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Family History of Rheumatoid Arthritis
primary_outcome.description: Family history is a component of clinical characteristics. Participants who had a family history of rheumatoid arthritis is recorded as yes/no. Also, family history related to parents, siblings, aunts and uncles, grandparents, or other is recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Co-morbidities
primary_outcome.description: Co-morbidity is a component of clinical characteristics It included stroke, heart failure (grades I, II, III or IV), ischemic heart disease, hypertension, dyslipidemia, osteoporosis, interstitial lung disease, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), depression, diabetes mellitus, liver disease, serious infections, tuberculosis, hematological malignancies, solid tumors and others. Participants were assessed into categories with associated co-morbidities as yes and no.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Extra-articular Manifestations at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: Extra-articular manifestations (EAMs) are a component of of clinical characteristics EAMs are symptoms and diseases that occur in parts of the body other than joints. These included the presence of amyloidosis (rare disease that results from the buildup of misfolded proteins), anemia (deficiency of red cells in the blood), heart complications, lung complications, rheumatoid nodules (local swelling), felty's syndrome (presence of rheumatoid arthritis, an enlarged spleen, and an abnormally low white blood cell count), and secondary Sjogren's (an autoimmune disorder that damages moisture-producing glands, making it difficult to produce saliva and tears). Participants were assessed into categories with extra-articular Manifestations as yes, no and missing nos.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Painful and Swollen Joints at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: Participants were assessed for painful and swollen joints at Visit 1. Painful joint is the most specific clinical method to quantify abnormalities in participants with RA. It reflects the amount of inflamed synovial tissue.

primary_outcome.measure: Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: The Physician's global assessment of disease activity is assessed using a 0 to 100 millimeter (mm) horizontal visual analogue scale (VAS). The left-hand extreme of the line equals 0 mm, and is described as "no disease activity" (symptom-free and no arthritis symptoms) and the right-hand extreme equals 100 mm, as "maximum disease activity" (maximum arthritis disease activity).

primary_outcome.measure: Patient's Global Assessment of Disease Activity at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: Patient global assessment of disease activity visual analog scale is assessed using a 0 to 100 mm horizontal VAS. The left-hand extreme of the line equals 0 mm, and is described as "no disease activity" (symptom-free and no arthritis symptoms) and the right-hand extreme equals 100 mm, as "maximum disease activity" (maximum arthritis disease activity).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Hematology Parameters Values Falling Within Reference Values at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: Hematology parameters are considered as one of the component of clinical characteristics. Hematology parameters included white blood cells (WBC), platelets, red blood cells (RBC), hemoglobin, hematocrit, neutrophils, basophils, eosinophils, lymphocytes, monocytes.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Biochemistry Parameters Values Falling Within Reference Values at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: Biochemistry parameters is considered as one of the component of clinical characteristics. Biochemistry parameters included alanine amino transferase (ALT), aspartate amino transferase (AST), triglycerides, total cholesterol, high density lipoprotein (HDL), low density lipoprotein (LDL), and total lipids.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Presence/Absence Rheumatoid Factor and Anti-Cyclic Citrullinated Protein Antibodies
primary_outcome.description: Rheumatoid Factor (RF) is the auto antibody directed against Immunoglobulin G and its concentration is observed in human serum or plasma. Anti-Cyclic Citrullinated Protein Antibodies (Anti-CCP) antibodies are auto antibodies (antibodies directed against 1 or more of an individual's own proteins) that are frequently detected in the blood of rheumatoid arthritis participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With C-reactive Protein and Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate Falling Within Reference Values at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: The test for C-reactive Protein (CRP) is a laboratory measurement for evaluation of an acute phase reactant of inflammation through the use of an ultra-sensitive assay. A decrease in the level of CRP indicates reduction in inflammation and therefore improvement. Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) is a laboratory test that provides a non-specific measure of inflammation. A higher rate is consistent with inflammation.

primary_outcome.measure: Patient Pain Visual Analog Scale Score at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: Participants assessed their pain using a 0 to 10 horizontal visual analogue scale (VAS). The left-hand extreme of the line equals 0 and is described as "no pain" and the right-hand extreme equals 10 as "unbearable pain"

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Joint Damage at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with joint damage is recorded as yes and no.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Score on Disease Activity Score Based on 28-Joints Count at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: Disease activity score (DAS) 28 is a combined index for measuring disease activity in RA. The index includes swollen (range 0-28) and tender (range 0-28) joint counts, acute phase response (ESR in mm/hr), and general health status (participant global assessment of disease activity using VAS, range 1-100 mm). DAS28, which uses a 28-joint count, is derived from the original DAS, which includes a 44-swollen joint count. The DAS28 scale ranges from 0 to 10, where higher scores indicate worsening.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Disease Activity Score by Categorization at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: DAS28 is divided into 4 categories as: remission <2.6, low activity 2.6-3.2, moderate 3.2-5.1 and high >5.1.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Score on Clinical Disease Activity Index at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: Clinical disease activity index (CDAI) of participants is a composite index that is calculated as the sum of number of painful joint, number of swollen joint, patient's VAS (0-10 cm) assessment, physician global VAS assessment (0-10 cm). The CDAI score ranges from 0 to 76, where lower scores indicate less disease activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinical Disease Activity by Categorization at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: CDAI is divided into 4 categories as: remission <2.8, low activity 2.8-10, moderate 10-22 and high>22.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Score on Simple Disease Activity Index at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: Simple Disease Activity Index (SDAI) is calculated by sum of number of painful joint and swollen joint count, patient and physician global assessment of disease activity (VAS 0-10 cm), and level of C-reactive protein in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL). SDAI total score ranges from 0 to 86, where higher scores indicates greater affect due to disease activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Simple Disease Activity Index Score by Categorization at Visit 1
primary_outcome.description: SDAI is divided into 4 categories as: remission (<3.3), low activity (3.3-11), moderate activity (11-26) and high activity (>26).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Prescribed First Synthetic Disease-Modifying Antirheumatic Drug Therapy Before the Study
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants prescribed with first synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug therapy (sDMARD) in monotherapy and in a combination before the study was presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Time Between Diagnosis and Prescription of First Synthetic Disease-Modifying Antirheumatic Drug or First Biologic Disease-Modifying Antirheumatic Drug
secondary_outcome.description: Mean time in months at Visit 1 between diagnosis and prescription of first sDMARD/ first bDMARD was presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Received Each sDMARD Before The Study
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who previously received sDMARDs before the study in at Visit 1 was reported. sDMARDS included azathioprine, penicillamine, sulfasalazine, hydroxychloroquine, gold salts, chloroquine, leflunomide, ciclosporin, methotrexate, and chlorambucil medications.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Received Last sDMARD Prescribed Before the Study
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who previously received sDMARDs before the study in at Visit 1 was reported. sDMARDS included azathioprine, penicillamine, sulfasalazine, hydroxychloroquine, gold salts, leflunomide, ciclosporin, methotrexate, and leflunomide + methotrexate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Prescribed First bDMARD Before the Study
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants prescribed first bDMARD before the study was presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Received Each bDMARD Before the Study
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participant who received bDMARD (etanercept, infliximab, golimumab, adalimumab, abatacept, tocilizumab, rituximab) before the study was reported in at Visit 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Time Between the Last sDMARD and bDMARD Received at Visit 1
secondary_outcome.description: Mean time between the last sDMARD and bDMARD received at Visit 1 was presented in months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Changing the Previous sDMARD/ bDMARD
secondary_outcome.description: Any reasons for changing the previous sDMARD/bDMARD treatment were recorded as lack of efficacy, adverse events, intolerance, clinical improvement and other. There may be more than one reason for changing sDMARD/ bDMARD per participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of sDMARD and bDMARDs Received Before the Study Treatment (bDMARD Monotherapy)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of sDMARD and bDMARDs received by Participants before the study was presented

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Received sDMARD, sDMARD+ bDMARD or bDMARD Immediately Before the Study Treatment
Number of Participants Discontinued the Previous Treatment and Started the Study Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The reasons for changing the previous sDMARD, sDMARD+ bDMARD or bDMARD treatment and starting the study treatment were recorded as lack of efficacy, adverse events, intolerance, clinical improvement, and other.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time Taking the Biologic Agent in Monotherapy Before the Study Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Median time in months taking the Biologic Agent in monotherapy before the study was presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Treated With Concomitant Medications Before the Study
secondary_outcome.description: Participants received concomitant medications (corticosteroids, non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs [NSAID], and other treatment) before the study were presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Received Current bDMARD Treatment at the Time of the Study
secondary_outcome.description: Current bDMARD treatment included etanercept, infliximab, adalimumab, abatacept, tocilizumab, rituximab and certolizumab.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Received Other Concomitant Treatments With the Current bDMARD Monotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: Other treatments included corticosteroids, NSAIDs and corticosteroid + NSAID.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Reasons for Starting Current Biologic Monotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: The reasons for changing current biologic treatment were recorded as lack of efficacy, adverse events, intolerance, clinical improvement and other.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Received Tocilizumab, Anti-Tumour Necrosis Factor and Other as a Monotherapy at the Time of the Study
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who received tocilizumab, Anti-tumour necrosis factor (TNF) and Other treatment of monotherapy were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Time of bDMARD Monotherapy Started at the Time of the Study Since Onset of RA
Number of sDMARD and bDMARDs Received Before the Study Treatment (Tocilizumab or Other Biologic Agent)
Mean Score on Disease Activity Score Based on 28-Joints Count, Clinical Disease Activity Index and Simple Disease Activity Index by Biologic Agent in Monotherapy at the Time of the Study
secondary_outcome.description: Mean score of DAS28 index, CDAI index, and SDAI index were recorded for participants who received biologic agent in monotherapy at the time of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Categorization of Disease Activity Based on Disease Activity Score, Clinical Disease Activity Index Score and Simple Disease Activity Index Score
secondary_outcome.description: Mean score of categorization (remission/low activity and moderate/high activity) of DAS28 index, CDAI index, and SDAI index was recorded for participants who received biologic agent in monotherapy at the time of the study .

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Joint Count for Painful Joints and Swollen Joints by Biologic Agent in Monotherapy at the Time of the Study
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who received biologic agent in monotherapy at the time of the study were assessed for a number of painful joints (NPJ) and swollen joints (NSJ).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Falling Within Reference Values For C-reactive Protein and Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate by Biologic Agent in Monotherapy at the Time of the Study
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who received biologic agent in monotherapy at the time of the study were assessed for C-reactive Protein (CRP) and Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events Leading to a Change of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of change of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: An Adverse Event was considered as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease associated with the use of the study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug. Adverse events were collected as a reason for the change to monotherapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Any Adverse Events and Any Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of change of treatment (to the current treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: An Any Adverse Events (AEs) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered to be related to the medicinal product. An Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) is any untoward medical occurrence that, at any dose, results in death, is life threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in disability/incapacity, or results in a congenital anomaly/birth defect.

arm_group.description: Patients with moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis (RA) will be treated with bDMARD (biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug) monotherapy under routine clinical practice conditions at rheumatology clinics

study_pop.textblock: Patients with moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, >/=18 years of age
- Patients with moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis who have had an inadequate response or intolerance to disease modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs) or other biological drugs
- Patients treated with biologic DMARDs alone for at least 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients not willing or unable to give written informed consent for participation in this study
- Patients who are participating in any clinical trial at the time of this study

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 210 participants were enrolled from 38 rheumatology units in Spain. This study was conducted between June 2012 and June 2013.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 210 participants, one participant was excluded from the study because of past history of biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (bDMARD) monotherapy under 6 months. Therefore, 209 participants were evaluated in this study.

group.title: bDMARD Monotherapy
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for rheumatoid arthritis (RA) in routine clinical practice.

A decrease in the level of CRP indicates reduction in inflammation and therefore improvement. Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) is a laboratory test that provides a non-specific measure of inflammation. A higher rate is consistent with inflammation.
measure.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

outcome.title: Patient Pain Visual Analog Scale Score at Visit 1
outcome.description: Participants assessed their pain using a 0 to 10 horizontal visual analogue scale (VAS). The left-hand extreme of the line equals 0 and is described as "no pain" and the right-hand extreme equals 10 as "unbearable pain"
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria. Out of 209 participants, 207 were analysed for patient pain visual analog scale.

group.title: bDMARD Monotherapy
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for rheumatoid arthritis (RA) in routine clinical practice.

measure.title: Patient Pain Visual Analog Scale Score at Visit 1
measure.description: Participants assessed their pain using a 0 to 10 horizontal visual analogue scale (VAS). The left-hand extreme of the line equals 0 and is described as "no pain" and the right-hand extreme equals 10 as "unbearable pain"
measure.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria. Out of 209 participants, 207 were analysed for patient pain visual analog scale.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Joint Damage at Visit 1
outcome.description: Number of participants with joint damage is recorded as yes and no.
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

group.title: bDMARD Monotherapy
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA in routine clinical practice.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Joint Damage at Visit 1
measure.description: Number of participants with joint damage is recorded as yes and no.
measure.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

outcome.title: Mean Score on Disease Activity Score Based on 28-Joints Count at Visit 1
outcome.description: Disease activity score (DAS) 28 is a combined index for measuring disease activity in RA. The index includes swollen (range 0-28) and tender (range 0-28) joint counts, acute phase response (ESR in mm/hr), and general health status (participant global assessment of disease activity using VAS, range 1-100 mm). DAS28, which uses a 28-joint count, is derived from the original DAS, which includes a 44-swollen joint count. The DAS28 scale ranges from 0 to 10, where higher scores indicate worsening.
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

group.title: bDMARD Monotherapy
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA in routine clinical practice.

measure.title: Mean Score on Disease Activity Score Based on 28-Joints Count at Visit 1
measure.description: Disease activity score (DAS) 28 is a combined index for measuring disease activity in RA. The index includes swollen (range 0-28) and tender (range 0-28) joint counts, acute phase response (ESR in mm/hr), and general health status (participant global assessment of disease activity using VAS, range 1-100 mm). DAS28, which uses a 28-joint count, is derived from the original DAS, which includes a 44-swollen joint count. The DAS28 scale ranges from 0 to 10, where higher scores indicate worsening.
measure.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Disease Activity Score by Categorization at Visit 1
outcome.description: DAS28 is divided into 4 categories as: remission <2.6, low activity 2.6-3.2, moderate 3.2-5.1 and high >5.1.
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

group.title: bDMARD Monotherapy
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA in routine clinical practice.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Disease Activity Score by Categorization at Visit 1
measure.description: DAS28 is divided into 4 categories as: remission <2.6, low activity 2.6-3.2, moderate 3.2-5.1 and high >5.1.
measure.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

outcome.title: Mean Score on Clinical Disease Activity Index at Visit 1
outcome.description: Clinical disease activity index (CDAI) of participants is a composite index that is calculated as the sum of number of painful joint, number of swollen joint, patient's VAS (0-10 cm) assessment, physician global VAS assessment (0-10 cm). The CDAI score ranges from 0 to 76, where lower scores indicate less disease activity.
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

group.title: bDMARD Monotherapy
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA in routine clinical practice.

measure.title: Mean Score on Clinical Disease Activity Index at Visit 1
measure.description: Clinical disease activity index (CDAI) of participants is a composite index that is calculated as the sum of number of painful joint, number of swollen joint, patient's VAS (0-10 cm) assessment, physician global VAS assessment (0-10 cm). The CDAI score ranges from 0 to 76, where lower scores indicate less disease activity.
measure.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Clinical Disease Activity by Categorization at Visit 1
outcome.description: CDAI is divided into 4 categories as: remission <2.8, low activity 2.8-10, moderate 10-22 and high>22.
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

group.title: bDMARD Monotherapy
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA in routine clinical practice.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Clinical Disease Activity by Categorization at Visit 1
measure.description: CDAI is divided into 4 categories as: remission <2.8, low activity 2.8-10, moderate 10-22 and high>22.
measure.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

outcome.title: Mean Score on Simple Disease Activity Index at Visit 1
outcome.description: Simple Disease Activity Index (SDAI) is calculated by sum of number of painful joint and swollen joint count, patient and physician global assessment of disease activity (VAS 0-10 cm), and level of C-reactive protein in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL). SDAI total score ranges from 0 to 86, where higher scores indicates greater affect due to disease activity.
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

group.title: bDMARD Monotherapy
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA in routine clinical practice.

measure.title: Mean Score on Simple Disease Activity Index at Visit 1

SDAI total score ranges from 0 to 86, where higher scores indicates greater affect due to disease activity.
measure.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Simple Disease Activity Index Score by Categorization at Visit 1
outcome.description: SDAI is divided into 4 categories as: remission (<3.3), low activity (3.3-11), moderate activity (11-26) and high activity (>26).
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events Leading to a Change of Treatment
outcome.description: An Adverse Event was considered as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease associated with the use of the study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug. Adverse events were collected as a reason for the change to monotherapy.
outcome.time_frame: At the time of change of treatment
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

group.title: bDMARD Monotherapy
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA in routine clinical practice.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events Leading to a Change of Treatment
measure.description: An Adverse Event was considered as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease associated with the use of the study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug. Adverse events were collected as a reason for the change to monotherapy.
measure.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Any Adverse Events and Any Serious Adverse Events
outcome.description: An Any Adverse Events (AEs) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered to be related to the medicinal product. An Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) is any untoward medical occurrence that, at any dose, results in death, is life threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in disability/incapacity, or results in a congenital anomaly/birth defect.
outcome.time_frame: At the time of change of treatment (to the current treatment)
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

group.title: bDMARD Monotherapy
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA in routine clinical practice.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Any Adverse Events and Any Serious Adverse Events
measure.description: An Any Adverse Events (AEs) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered to be related to the medicinal product. An Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) is any untoward medical occurrence that, at any dose, results in death, is life threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in disability/incapacity, or results in a congenital anomaly/birth defect.
measure.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who met the screening criteria.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor’s intellectual property rights.
